intro: Hieracium caesium subsp. madarodes, commonly known as the Madarodes hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaves. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and meadows. It produces yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months, and its leaves are usually hairy and serrated. This subspecies is often found in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to thrive in moderate climates.
